title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Construction and Building Inspectors

content.rendered:
What are Construction and Building Inspectors?

Construction and Building Inspectors make sure that construction follows building ordinances and regulations.

Where do Construction and Building Inspectors work?

  • Construction companies
  • Government
  • Engineering companies

How much do Construction and Building Inspectors make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for Construction and Building Inspectors is $46,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Construction and Building Inspectors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Engineering majors
  • Architecture majors
  • Construction technology majors
Search relevant jobs

Construction and Building Inspector skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Construction and Building Inspectors succeed in their work:

  • Physical stamina
  • Attention to detail
  • Knowledge of applicable equipment and their mechanics

What are some common questions about Construction and Building Inspectors?

Q: Do Construction and Building Inspectors need to be licensed?

A: No, but it is highly recommended.
